q: Environmental Science is introduced by __________.

Environmental Science explores the effects of environmental changes on human __________.
Environmental Science researches __________ measures and management measures for the comprehensive prevention and control of regional environmental pollution.

One main goal of Environmental Science is to learn how the __________ world works.
Environmental Science aims to understand how humans __________ with the environment.
A goal of Environmental Science is to determine how humans __________ the environment.
Environmental Science is an __________ science.
To address environmental issues, we need to examine scientific principles and apply them to __________ systems.
The __________ Method is a method of procedure that has characterized natural science since the 17th century.
The environmental system or __________ is the fundamental ecological unit for the study of the environment.
__________ ecosystems are one type of ecosystem studied in Environmental Science.
The biospheric ecosystem is governed by discernible __________.
Environmental processes occur __________ without the intervention or aid of man.
__________ disasters are major adverse events resulting from natural processes of the Earth.
The phrase 'Know disasters. No disasters.' emphasizes the importance of understanding __________.
The __________ Syndrome refers to the gradual acceptance of worsening conditions.
There is continuous creation, maintenance, destruction and recreation of __________ materials of the earth.
__________ services are the direct and indirect contributions of ecosystems to human well-being.
__________ services include food, fresh water, wood, fiber, genetic resources and medicines.
__________ services include climate regulation, natural hazard regulation, water purification and waste management.
__________ services refer to ecosystems providing habitat for migratory species and maintaining gene-pool viability.
__________ services include spiritual enrichment, intellectual development, recreation and aesthetic values.
Environmental challenges include contamination of natural resources, also known as __________.
__________ and non-renewable resources running out is a major environmental challenge.
__________ change is a significant environmental problem.
Physical and biological processes operate according to the law of __________.
The Law of Uniformitarianism was proposed by __________.
__________ stated, 'we find no vestige of a beginning â€“ no prospect of an end.'
The natural environmental system is governed by __________ mechanism.
Ecosystem stability is also known as Environmental __________.
There is a __________ relationship between abiotic and biotic components of the natural environmental system.
The __________ approach to man-environment relationships is based on the idea that the environment completely controls man and his activities.
The __________ approach is based on religious faith of man being superior to nature and all other creatures.
The __________ approach suggests that the natural environment offers possible avenues for human development, with the choice being a human decision.
The __________ deterministic approach is based on the ideology of man's mastery over environment and continued economic and industrial expansion.
The __________ approach is based on the basic principles of Ecology and considers man as an integral part of the environment.
The __________ approach refers to using geographic science supported by GIS as a framework for understanding our world.
